intro: Tolypanthus pustulatus, commonly known as the warty pustule plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, warty stems and showy, yellowish flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
